hours_text:
#  Plan Your Visit to Battleship New Jersey

Step aboard the historic decks of Battleship New Jersey, America’s most decorated battleship, and explore living history! From World War II to the 1980's, this legendary ship served in major conflicts earning her 19 battle and campaign stars. As a museum, this iconic ship continues her legacy by serving as a floating museum on the Camden Waterfront. Climb aboard for interactive exhibits, hands-on activities—perfect for kids, scouts, or school field trips. Our exhibits offer a fascinating look at naval history—perfect for history buffs, veterans, and enthusiasts alike. Whether you're in Camden or exploring New Jersey, this is a must-visit destination—rated #1 Things to do in Camden by Trip Advisor!

Guests can explore miles of tour routes—both guided or self-guided—and also add-on exciting experiences like firing the 40mm saluting gun or 5-inch gun or booking a monthly guided, evening tour through Turret II or an Engine Room. Guests can also experience life as a sailor by booking an overnight encampment, which allows guests to sleep in the bunks and grab meals from the show line. We even offer historic and unique event spaces for celebrating birthday parties, proms, retirement ceremonies, and so much more! For school groups and summer campers, we also offer group tours with the addition of customizable scavenger hunts and exciting educational lessons. This historic ship offers a memorable experience for everyone!

About this capture

COLLECTED BY

Organization: [Archive Team](https://archive.org/details/archiveteam)

Formed in 2009, the Archive Team (not to be confused with the archive.org Archive-It Team) is a rogue archivist collective dedicated to saving copies of rapidly dying or deleted websites for the sake of history and digital heritage. The group is 100% composed of volunteers and interested parties, and has expanded into a large amount of related projects for saving online and digital history. 

History is littered with hundreds of conflicts over the future of a community, group, location or business that were "resolved" when one of the parties stepped ahead and destroyed what was there. With the original point of contention destroyed, the debates would fall to the wayside. Archive Team believes that by duplicated condemned data, the conversation and debate can continue, as well as the richness and insight gained by keeping the materials. Our project...
